acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Richmond County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Richmond County was formed from old Rappahannock County in 1692.
The will books of Richmond in this collection were created by the County Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Will Books, 1717-1787, of Richmond County Court. The will book includes the name of testator, list of heirs and the year the wills were proven in court and probate records such as inventories and appraisements. The will books have indexes which contains the first and last names of both parties. It is arranged alphabetically from A-Z.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Richmond Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records On Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia web site.
